meanings.sent1: She disbudded the rose bush carefully.
meanings.sent2: The gardener disbudded the shrub to promote growth.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel disbudded all the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The storm disbudded the trees, leaving them bare and vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she disbudded the daisy, leaving it looking neat and tidy.

meanings.sent1: The farmer disbudded the fruit tree to redirect its energy.
meanings.sent2: The harsh winter disbudded many of the plants in the field.
meanings.sent3: The naughty rabbit disbudded the young saplings in the orchard.
meanings.sent4: The disease disbudded the once flourishing garden, leaving it barren.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully disbudded the rose bush, ensuring it would bloom beautifully next season.
